step1.sentence: After landing two major clients in a row, Sarah knew they had to keep momentum to hit their annual target.

step2.story: The startup had just closed its Series A funding and the team was buzzing with energy. The CEO gathered everyone and said they needed to keep momentum by launching the beta version within the month. No one wanted to lose the wave of excitement that investors had sparked.

step3.story: After months of grueling preparation, the marathon runner crossed the halfway mark feeling stronger than ever. Her coach had always told her the hardest part was not starting but finding a way to keep momentum through the final stretch. She focused on her breathing and matched her stride to the rhythm of her playlist. Around kilometer thirty, her legs began to scream, but she remembered the months of early mornings and rainy runs. She refused to slow down. When she finally crossed the finish line with a personal best, she realized that keeping momentum had been more of a mental battle than a physical one.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 'momentum(추진력, 탄력)'을 'keep(유지하다)'한다는 뜻으로, 움직임이나 진행의 힘을 계속 이어간다는 의미입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 프로젝트, 운동, 사업 등에서 좋은 흐름이나 기세를 잃지 않고 계속 유지할 때 사용합니다. '기세를 이어가다', '탄력을 유지하다'라는 뉘앙스로 쓰입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: momentum은 라틴어 'movimentum(움직임)'에서 유래했으며, 물리학에서 운동량을 뜻하다가 비유적으로 '추진력, 기세'라는 의미로 확장되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 '계속하다'보다는 이미 생긴 좋은 흐름이나 기세를 놓치지 않겠다는 적극적이고 전략적인 뉘앙스를 담고 있습니다. 비즈니스, 스포츠, 자기계발 맥락에서 자주 쓰입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: We need to keep momentum if we want to finish the project on time.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 프로젝트를 제때 끝내려면 추진력을 유지해야 합니다.
